title: Drawing, "Scale Drawing for Screen Design:  "Early Warning System," Front Side", ca. 1987
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, center left:  1470; lower center:  738; additional mathematical notations throughout.
description: A contour, scale drawing of measurements for three-panel Early Warning System screen.  Left and center panel form a checked square, with lightning bolt at left. A triangular panel intersects this square from the right.  In upper margins and lower right of sheet are drawings of a shelf/seat and various supports for screen.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Scale Drawing for Screen Design:  "Early Warning System," Front Side", ca. 1987.
ca. 1987. Graphite on white tracing paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-93.
